text: i ran a fresh allnightly this morning
something weird happened with nightly and we havent pulled decks recently
by something weird do you mean `http.client.BadStatusLine` or are you referring to something else?
btw http 301s are annoying so you probably won’t be able to see the partner card pages until your cache refreshes

text: i think it was because slack was down
im not sure, honestly i didnt take a close look
it failed on nightly.py so all the other allnightly stuff completed
so once its fixed we can just run nightl
seems like your gulp thing <@U28TLDP0R>
I’ll take a look
it’s fine now
allnightly just needs to be in the web dir when running nightly to read in the gulpfile
fixed as in thats what we need to do, or fixed in that we don’t need to have it in the right dir?
we can just do a `cd` at the beginning of allnightly
yeah I did that
kk
turns out I always call those scripts from the web dir so I never noticed this requirement until now
<@U28TLDP0R> instead of doing click & drag with card images i was thinking about earlier…. can we just have an add card field which is text, but when you add it then it shows up as cards below
the card itself can have an (x) on it to remove it
or do you think it’s still worth the reduced effort to do text lists?
i dont feel that strongly about it
I think text lists is mandatory for it to be useful
I know I won’t use this thing if the only option is moving around images
there isn’t any moving around images
I don’t fully understand your description it’s a little ambiguous to me
taking another look at your mockup, and taking a step back… i think the card input box + the box that contains the decklist are two different thigns
unlike the recs page right now
your mockup has a big white box for decklist, and i dont want to have the decklist as the current cards i have added to be the same place im inputting cards
so instead of having just the maindeck textarea we could have the maindeck textarea + a preview of the decklist beneath it
yeah thats what i mean, but the preview doesn’t need to be card images
the preview seems mandatory to me if we are adding cards from the recs on the side or other places
eventually adding cards from edhrec pages for example
also i just want to see where the deck is at, sort by cmc or type so i can see which gaps i need to fill still
both deckstats and tappedout are like that
^ card input is either through the text box on the top or the filter table thingy at the bottom
decklist is on the right
yeah
I’ve looked at them both quite a bit
tappedout is a bit different. in tappedout you can enter the card on the left, but you can also edit the box on the right. I don’t like tappedout because i can’t see wha the cards ive added do

both their deckbuilders have too much ui complexity.  I think we can do deck preview and an individual card input, and I’d like to do that without it turning into an excel spreadsheet or a jumble of html inputs
I’ll update the mockup with my current idea
i agree. we do need all those files in the tappedout one though-- but i think you can add the card w/ text adn then click on it to select the specific edition you are looking for
for alpha we don’t need different card editions, just remember eventually i think we do
files?  all the inputs?
fields yeah
sorry
let’s do away with tags for now as well, i think that can be added later. you ok with that?
really?  I don’t think it’ll take very long at all
well with tags we want to also be able to show a list of decks with a tag, probably implement some sort of tag consolidation thing
be able to store tags in the database
seems below the threshold for mvp to me
just a multi-select with a pre-built list of terms?
pre-built definitely makes it easier
it’s definitely the way to go
can just use archetype/tag lists from other deckbuilders to get the common ones
we can just crowdsource it here wont be a big deal
not sure if complicated from a UI perspective, but one way to make it seem less busy is to only have one commander box; have the second one pop up if you input a partner in
I’ll probably do something like that
should’ve just done this mockup in inkscape
maybe replace the input box with the commander image once its been input perhaps
I was thinking the green checkmark would be sufficient for showing the user the input was accepted
i guess in similar style as the input / decklist separation, i’d like to be able to look at what the card does
whether thats a card image or a text box w/ a hover

this conversation overall is really emphasizing that i think the overall feel i want to the thing is to let people “figure out their deck” while they are interacting with the builder, card by card. Instead, usually when I go to deckstats i’ve already figured out my deck and are just doing data entry
we also do need to handle the data entry use case, too, however
does that make sense?
yes
current thoughts:

keeping the left panel and right panel both 1 column is easiest especially when considering lower resolutions.  on mobile the plan would be for the right panel to drop below everything in the left panel and both take up full screen width
before I favored deck info on top but with this number of inputs it makes more sense to have deck editor on top so that it lines up better with the right panel
yeah i like it

I think individual card entry can just be a typeahead with single cards (basically what we have in the navbar), but one of the tabs in the right panel can be a “card explorer” which could be as basic as filtering all cards by string and getting a list of them or could be more advanced and basically show any of our webpage content
you wouldn’t be able to have that and recs open at the same time though, so if we want that ten I guess we have to shove it in the deck editor
I kinda like having multiple save buttons so you don’t have to scroll away from the deck editor to save, but I’m not 100% sure yet.  easy to mess with down the line
(multiple deletes in particular looks kinda strange)
one nice thing about multiple saves though is that you can put decklist-relevant errors in a message above that save button and deckinfo-relevant error messages near the other save button
question: is “on-the-fly” deck preview and recommendation updates part of the mvp, or should we start out with refreshing when you hit save?
alternatively a “refresh” button somewhere
and note since it’s react “save” won’t have an annoying page reload
i think i’d like to be part of the mvp, but i could be convinced otherwise
something that stadns out from other deck builders needs to be in the first release
yeah, it would be pretty flashy
another note is that I’m gonna try to handle all the “is this a valid card/commander” validation on the client side
not sure where exactly to draw the line regarding what should live in the javascript file and what will warrant a server request
probably don’t want to put AllCards.json in the deckbuilder js, but definitely want cardnames and commander legality, and whatever we need to sort the decklist preview.
probably should just do both
I wonder how big AllCards.json is without all the card text
9.1M with text 4.7M without
hmmm
can we just hit the scryfall api directly?
well cross domain shit wont let us do that right?
would definitely have to ask them permission
cross server stuff is usually blocked and has to be whitelisted

hm should have geen goodtheme3
Wyah thats a good idea to move it
is this the right approach, piecing together a SELECT execution string?
i use get_cards into the cards table/(cache?) to ask about the include/exclude cards, but deck profile questions i'm asking decks(withprices)
Not sure what you mean
Selects should only be in database.py
The advanced search function in database doesnt use select statements if im not mistaken
We can likely speed it up by just doing one query though
i'm taking all the options and making a big select statement, e.g.:

SELECT url FROM {0}deckswithprices WHERE (tribe=%(goodtribe1)s OR tribe=%(goodtribe2)s OR tribe=%(goodtribe3)s) AND NOT tribe=%(badtribe1)s AND (theme=%(goodtheme1)s OR theme=%(goodtheme2)s) AND NOT theme=%(badtheme1)s AND NOT commander=%(badcommander1)s AND NOT commander=%(badcommander2)s
for everything but the card lists. for those, i use database.get_card
Im ok supporting just one tribe and one theme
What i suggest is implementing a select statement wrapper in database that does the multiple columns. Then calling that from your function
ok so the code that actually assembles the select statement string should move to database, yes? to keep all the actual sql strings in there
i'll look around database some more
Actially we might need to use donkeypenis for this!
i was wondering about that
So donkeypenis is a standin for null because unfortunately the syntax for checking null is different
What you can do is in your function is set the defaults to everything to be donkeypenis or your arbitrary string of choice
So like goodtribe default is donkeypenis
Either way give it a try and let me know how it goes
Ill be able to help out in an hour or so
k
k kids and wife are down so i can do whatever
you need help or you want to figure it out?
i think i have it working, but not sure if its working the way you want
i can split the function up and move parts to the relevant files
hmmm
so this is a problem hold on

```
postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices WHERE tribe <> 'DONKEYPENIS';
 count 
-------
 41147
(1 row)

Time: 370.619 ms
postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices WHERE tribe='Elf';
 count 
-------
  3221
(1 row)

Time: 0.924 ms
postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices WHERE tribe <> 'Goblin';
 count 
-------
 38385
(1 row)

Time: 61.014 ms

```
see that when  i scan the table for donkeypenis it takes a third of a second
in my opinion it’s OK to not have badtribe + badtheme
let’s just keep positive tribe and positive theme
let’s have “No Tribe” as an option for tribe
`SELECT COUNT(*) FROM deckswithprices WHERE tribe IS NOT NULL;`
exclusion searches take longer than inclusion searches
not quite
when the thing is in the index like goblin its fast
actually if you look at it, it is significantly slower than = elf
elf is 1 ms
not goblin is 61ms
donkeypenis on the other hand is 370ms
so for theme and tribe, just do positive tribe or is not null
ok, exclude commander?
you know im not sure if we need that either
what do you think
on the envisioned front end, would you want to exclude cards that you're tired of seeing?
like a personal bad list
say i know i'm building a zurgo deck, but i'm tired of playing worldslayer. i put it on a personal list of cards i don't want to see, maybe just for this particular deck i'm building
yeah
man the cards table is slow as balls these days

```postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards WHERE card='Exploration';
 count 
-------
 14637
(1 row)

Time: 1230.518 ms```
that one has a cache, ya?
not really
leme vacuum it and see what happens
might take a bit
once i have a list of urls, where do i send them to see an interesting web page
vacuum is like defrag for tables
<@U28TLDP0R> do you want to handle advanced search with a api+json and react? or just old style dynamic
im feeling api+json and react
jfc

```
postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards WHERE card='Exploration';
 count 
-------
 14637
(1 row)

Time: 1230.518 ms
```

```
postgres=# \d cards
          Table "public.cards"
 Column |       Type        | Modifiers 
--------+-------------------+-----------
 url    | character varying | 
 card   | character varying | 
 count  | integer           | 
Indexes:
    "cards_card_idx4" btree (card)
    "cards_url_card_idx" btree (url, card)
    "cards_url_idx4" btree (url)

postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards;
  count   
----------
 20886245
(1 row)

Time: 17724.162 ms
postgres=# VACUUM ANALYZE cards;
VACUUM
Time: 75424.679 ms
postgres=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards WHERE card='Exploration';
 count 
-------
 14637
(1 row)

Time: 4.920 ms
```
vacuuming took it down to 5ms
that vacuum might actually speed up other things too
yup. advanced filters is faster now
lol
alright well im going to go dick around wiht some video games. nate if you want some help with the sql side let me know and ill take a look
